title: Why the ANC is throttling the university budget
text:
The ANC govt spends 20% of national budget on schools, many of which are very low fee schools.
If they applied the same budgetary standards to universities, assuming 20% of matriculants should go to university (and should pay a similar proportion and quantum of low fees as schools, which they don't, having to pay fees similar to private schools), and that per student capita, students at university cost say 2 x the cost of schoolgoers, the govt should by that logic budget 8% of national budget for universities , which would be an unparalleled investment in our future.
However, they are only funding to the tune of 0.6%, ie 1/13th of what they should be funding The numbers always reveal the truth.
 If anything, university funding should be even greater than pro-rata to schooling. I think there's a story here.
I recently saw a graph showing that for each province, the ANC level of support is directly inverse to the level of maths and science skills, and the ANC know it.
They know that a large proportion of qualified students will not vote ANC. I believe that their covert policy is that schools are designed to educate those that through lack of funds are forced to go to state non-Model C schools (ie about 80% of learners) only sufficiently to function as "hewers of wood, carriers of water and voters of the ANC", and to squeeze university funding to 1/12 of what it logically should be as a proportion of the schools budget.
All the facts (tolerance of SADTU, abolishing teacher training colleges, OBE that was doomed to fail learners, WEF ratings at #142 out of 144 countries, 30% pass rate for matric, university funding at 1/13 of what it should be, etc) all fit perfectly and consistently with this theory.
